intro: Xanthochymus pictorius, commonly known as the painted yew, is a rare and striking plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It is characterized by its unique foliage, featuring bright yellow and green variegation that gives it its common name. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and requires a cool, humid climate. Due to its rarity and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
